intro: Spyridium coactilifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spyridium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its fruits are small, woody capsules that contain seeds. This species is of interest in horticulture due to its ornamental value and ecological significance in native ecosystems.
